page.title: 08A Health Visitor,Pin Green.
page.content: People can only become health visitors after they are experienced nurses.To become a nurse you need at least 5"O" levels,and some "A"levels for a 3 year course.After a person has been an S.R.N.(State Registered Nurse)for a few years,they can take extra courses like Obstetrics (looking after mothers and babies) or midwifery (delivering babies)and then take the postgraduate course to become a health visitor.This lasts for one year and includes topics such as psychology and sociology. Mrs.Staines,who works in St.Nicholas Health Centre,has been doing this job for 3 years in Stevenage. She is part of the{Primary Health Care Team}and works alongside G.P.s,District Nurses and Social Workers.She enjoys it very much because she likes meeting people of all ages,it uses all aspects of her brain and she is always learning.
